sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand Twynsta, containing telmisartan/amlodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand Twynsta,
Drug Label for drug brand Twynsta,

sentence.text: TWYNSTA tablets are contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity (e.g., anaphylaxis or angioedema) to telmisartan, amlodipine, or any other component of this product see Adverse Reactions (6.2).
Do not co-administer aliskiren with TWYNSTA in patients with diabetes see Drug Interactions (7.2).
<item>Known hypersensitivity (e.g., anaphylaxis or angioedema) to telmisartan, amlodipine or any other component of this product (4)
<item>Do not co-administer aliskiren with TWYNSTA in patients with diabetes (4)
<item>Avoid concomitant use with an ACE inhibitor (5.6)

mmtx.phraseText: concomitant use with an ACE inhibitor

sentence.text: Telmisartan Use of drugs that act on the renin-angiotensin system during the second and third trimesters of pregnancy reduces fetal renal function and increases fetal and neonatal morbidity and death.

In patients with an activated renin-angiotensin system, such as volume- or salt-depleted patients (e.g., those being treated with high doses of diuretics), symptomatic hypotension may occur after initiation of therapy with TWYNSTA tablets.

mmtx.phraseText: treated with high doses of diuretics

sentence.text: Hyperkalemia may occur in patients on ARBs, particularly in patients with advanced renal impairment, heart failure, on renal replacement therapy, or on potassium supplements, potassium-sparing diuretics, potassium-containing salt substitutes or other drugs that increase potassium levels.
Consider periodic determinations of serum electrolytes to detect possible electrolyte imbalances, particularly in patients at risk.

mmtx.phraseText: periodic determinations of serum electrolytes to

sentence.text: Since patients with hepatic impairment have decreased clearance of amlodipine, start amlodipine or add amlodipine at 2.5 mg in patients with hepatic impairment.
As a consequence of inhibiting the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system, anticipate changes in renal function in susceptible individuals.

In patients whose renal function may depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (e.g., patients with severe congestive heart failure or renal dysfunction), treatment with angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors and angiotensin receptor antagonists has been associated with oliguria and/or progressive azotemia and (rarely) with acute renal failure and/or death.

mmtx.phraseText: depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system
depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system

sentence.text: In studies of ACE inhibitors in patients with unilateral or bilateral renal artery stenosis, increases in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen were observed.
There has been no long term use of telmisartan in patients with unilateral or bilateral renal artery stenosis, but anticipate an effect similar to that seen with ACE inhibitors.

mmtx.phraseText: no long term use of telmisartan

sentence.text: 5.6 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System

mmtx.phraseText: 5.6 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System
5.6 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System
5.6 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System

sentence.text: As a consequence of inhibiting the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system, changes in renal function (including acute renal failure) have been reported.
Dual blockade of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (e.g., by adding an ACE-inhibitor to an angiotensin II receptor antagonist) should include close monitoring of renal function.

mmtx.phraseText: an ACE-inhibitor to an angiotensin II receptor antagonist
an ACE-inhibitor to an angiotensin II receptor antagonist

sentence.text: The ONTARGET trial enrolled 25,620 patients 55 years old with atherosclerotic disease or diabetes with end-organ damage, randomized them to telmisartan only, ramipril only, or the combination, and followed them for a median of 56 months.

Patients receiving the combination of telmisartan and ramipril did not obtain any additional benefit compared to monotherapy, but experienced an increased incidence of renal dysfunction (e.g., acute renal failure) compared with groups receiving telmisartan alone or ramipril alone.
Concomitant use of telmisartan and ramipril is not recommended.
Amlodipine (5 to 10 mg per day) has been studied in a placebo-controlled trial of 1153 patients with NYHA Class III or IV heart failure on stable doses of ACE inhibitor, digoxin, and diuretics.

mmtx.phraseText: IV heart failure on stable doses of ACE inhibitor,

sentence.text: In the PRAISE-2 study, 1654 patients with NYHA class III (80%) or IV (20%) heart failure without evidence of underlying ischemic disease, on stable doses of ACE inhibitor (99%), digitalis (99%), and diuretics (99%) were randomized 1:1 to receive placebo or amlodipine and followed for a mean of 33 months.

While there was no statistically significant difference between amlodipine and placebo in the primary endpoint of all cause mortality (95% confidence limits from 8% reduction to 29% increase on amlodipine), there were more reports of pulmonary edema in the patients on amlodipine.

ellipsisSentence.text: In the PRAISE-2 study, 1654 patients with NYHA class III (80%) or IV (20%) heart failure without evidence of underlying ischemic disease, on stable doses of ACE inhibitor (99%), digitalis (99%), and diuretics (99%) were randomized 1:1 to receive placebo or amlodipine and followed for a mean of 33 months.

In the PRAISE-2 study, 1654 patients with NYHA class III (80%) or IV (20%) heart failure without evidence of underlying ischemic disease, on stable doses of ACE inhibitor (99%), digitalis (99%), and diuretics (99%) were randomized 1:1 to receive placebo or amlodipine and followed for a mean of 33 months.

In the PRAISE-2 study, 1654 patients with NYHA class III (80%) or IV (20%) heart failure without evidence of underlying ischemic disease, on stable doses of ACE inhibitor (99%), digitalis (99%), and diuretics (99%) were randomized 1:1 to receive placebo or amlodipine and followed for a mean of 33 months.

sentence.text: <item>NSAIDS: Increased risk of renal impairment and loss of antihypertensive effect (7)
<item>If simvastatin is co-administered with amlodipine, do not exceed doses greater than 20 mg daily of simvastatin (7)

entity.text: do not exceed doses greater than

mmtx.phraseText: greater than 20 mg daily of simvastatin

sentence.text: <item>Do not co-administer aliskiren with TWYNSTA in patients with diabetes (7.2)
The pharmacokinetics of amlodipine and telmisartan are not altered when the drugs are co-administered.

No drug interaction studies have been conducted with TWYNSTA tablets and other drugs, although studies have been conducted with the individual amlodipine and telmisartan components of TWYNSTA tablets, as described below:
Aliskiren: Do not co-administer aliskiren with TWYNSTA in patients with diabetes.
Avoid use of aliskiren with TWYNSTA in patients with renal impairment (GFR 60 mL/min).
Digoxin: When telmisartan was co-administered with digoxin, median increases in digoxin peak plasma concentration (49%) and in trough concentration (20%) were observed.

mmtx.phraseText: median increases in digoxin peak plasma concentration
median increases in digoxin peak plasma concentration

sentence.text: Therefore, monitor digoxin levels when initiating, adjusting, and discontinuing telmisartan for the purpose of keeping the digoxin level within the therapeutic range.

mmtx.phraseText: discontinuing telmisartan for the purpose of keeping

sentence.text: Lithium: Reversible increases in serum lithium concentrations and toxicity have been reported during concomitant administration of lithium with angiotensin II receptor antagonists including telmisartan.

mmtx.phraseText: Reversible increases in serum lithium concentrations

sentence.text: Therefore, monitor serum lithium levels during concomitant use.

mmtx.phraseText: monitor serum lithium levels during concomitant use.

ellipsisSentence.text: Lithium: Reversible increases in serum lithium concentrations and toxicity have been reported during concomitant administration of lithium with angiotensin II receptor antagonists including telmisartan.

sentence.text: Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Agents including Selective Cyclooxygenase-2 Inhibitors (COX-2 Inhibitors): In patients who are elderly, volume-depleted (including those on diuretic therapy), or with compromised renal function, co-administration of NSAIDs, including selective COX-2 inhibitors, with angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including telmisartan, may result in deterioration of renal function, including possible acute renal failure.
Monitor renal function periodically in patients receiving telmisartan and NSAID therapy.
The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including telmisartan may be attenuated by NSAIDs including selective COX-2 inhibitors.

mmtx.phraseText: The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists,

sentence.text: Ramipril and Ramiprilat: Co-administration of telmisartan 80 mg once daily and ramipril 10 mg once daily to healthy subjects increases steady-state Cmax and AUC of ramipril 2.3- and 2.1-fold, respectively, and Cmax and AUC of ramiprilat 2.4- and 1.5-fold, respectively.
In contrast, Cmax and AUC of telmisartan decrease by 31% and 16%, respectively.

ellipsisSentence.text: Ramipril and Ramiprilat: Co-administration of telmisartan 80 mg once daily and ramipril 10 mg once daily to healthy subjects increases steady-state Cmax and AUC of ramipril 2.3- and 2.1-fold, respectively, and Cmax and AUC of ramiprilat 2.4- and 1.5-fold, respectively.

Ramipril and Ramiprilat: Co-administration of telmisartan 80 mg once daily and ramipril 10 mg once daily to healthy subjects increases steady-state Cmax and AUC of ramipril 2.3- and 2.1-fold, respectively, and Cmax and AUC of ramiprilat 2.4- and 1.5-fold, respectively.

Ramipril and Ramiprilat: Co-administration of telmisartan 80 mg once daily and ramipril 10 mg once daily to healthy subjects increases steady-state Cmax and AUC of ramipril 2.3- and 2.1-fold, respectively, and Cmax and AUC of ramiprilat 2.4- and 1.5-fold, respectively.

Ramipril and Ramiprilat: Co-administration of telmisartan 80 mg once daily and ramipril 10 mg once daily to healthy subjects increases steady-state Cmax and AUC of ramipril 2.3- and 2.1-fold, respectively, and Cmax and AUC of ramiprilat 2.4- and 1.5-fold, respectively.

sentence.text: When co-administering telmisartan and ramipril, the response may be greater because of the possibly additive pharmacodynamic effects of the combined drugs, and also because of the increased exposure to ramipril and ramiprilat in the presence of telmisartan.

mmtx.phraseText: ramiprilat in the presence of telmisartan.
ramiprilat in the presence of telmisartan.

sentence.text: Co-administration of telmisartan and ramipril is not recommended.

Other Drugs: Co-administration of telmisartan did not result in a clinically significant interaction with acetaminophen, amlodipine, glyburide, simvastatin, hydrochlorothiazide, warfarin, or ibuprofen.

Telmisartan is not expected to interact with drugs that inhibit cytochrome P450 enzymes, it is also not expected to interact with drugs metabolized by cytochrome P450 enzymes, except for possible inhibition of the metabolism of drugs metabolized by CYP2C19.

In clinical trials, amlodipine has been safely administered with thiazide diuretics, beta-blockers, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, long-acting nitrates, sublingual nitroglycerin, digoxin, warfarin, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, antibiotics, and oral hypoglycemic drugs.
Simvastatin: Co-administration of multiple doses of 10 mg of amlodipine with 80 mg simvastatin resulted in a 77% increase in exposure to simvastatin compared to simvastatin alone.

mmtx.phraseText: Co-administration of multiple doses of 10 mg of amlodipine

sentence.text: Limit the dose of simvastatin in patients on amlodipine to 20 mg daily.
The following have no clinically relevant effects on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine: cimetidine, grapefruit juice, magnesium and aluminum hydroxide antacid, sildenafil.

mmtx.phraseText: no clinically relevant effects on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine

sentence.text: Amlodipine has no clinically relevant effects on the pharmacokinetics or pharmacodynamics of the following: atorvastatin, digoxin, warfarin.
Co-administration of a 180 mg daily dose of diltiazem with 5 mg amlodipine in elderly hypertensive patients resulted in a 60% increase in amlodipine systemic exposure.

mmtx.phraseText: Co-administration of a 180 mg daily dose of diltiazem

sentence.text: Erythromycin co-administration in healthy volunteers did not significantly change amlodipine systemic exposure.
However, strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, ritonavir) may increase the plasma concentrations of amlodipine to a greater extent.
Monitor for symptoms of hypotension and edema when amlodipine is co-administered with CYP3A4 inhibitors.
No information is available on the quantitative effects of CYP3A4 inducers (e.g., carbamazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin, fosphenytoin, primidone, rifampicin, St. John's Wort) on amlodipine.
Patients should be monitored for adequate clinical effect when amlodipine is co-administered with CYP3A4 inducers.
